title: Zoomic
author: Zoomic
content: I found a job advert that is willing to pay a shit poster. I was surprised because shit posting is heavily frowned at in this forum. So, there is a place shitposters are needed in reddit.Quote [Hiring] ShitpostingYeah the title says it, you get paid when you shitpost.Requirements-Your reddit account older that 45 days-Must have above 70 "comment karma"-Your account must be able to upvote (make sure you're not "upvote banned")This prompted me to ask these questions;1. What is shitposting?2. What should we check out for in a post, such that when we see it we can confidently call the post a shit post3. Is there any difference between shitposting and spamming?

comments.author: Cantsay

Inappropriate posting types like shitposting, spamming and off topic have no place on BTT forums anymore. Now that those whose habits are hard to change have a place to breed, they can get paid for posting trash every day. Thankfully the shitposter you're referring to has nothing to do with the forum, So I don't think there's any connection here at all because this happened on Reddit.

comments.author: youdacapt
comments.body: Quote from: Zoomic on August 17, 2023, 11:47:16 AM1. What is shitposting? Anywhere you see shit posting; it simply means that the hiring project does not care the manner of approach you take to market their links, or presales or services; they just want their project name, links etc plastered all over reddit. No constructive post is needed; no sanity is needed; just post every topics or threads or comments about their services thats all. Quote 2. What should we check out for in a post, such that when we see it we can confidently call the post a shit postShit-posting are easy to identify. 1. Off topic - either you are talking about A or B or Z; they do not care; they simply copy and paste their contents.2. They are usually a one line or one sentence comments/posts with links etc 3. They are easily identifiable because the sentence means nothing. 4. They are most likely spamming in numbers (more than 1 comments). Quote3. Is there any difference between shitposting and spamming?There is a thin line difference; but i am not sure if it means much anyway. In a shitpost; there is a target audience; it could be a presale post, or crypto community or football community or a metaverse subreddit / topic. Meanwhile for spamming; it doesn't matter if its a political post or crypto or religious post; they post their contents everywhere n large numbers.
